column5: There are many styles,sizes and colors of Mepps Spinners.What is your favorite Mepps Spinners for catching Walleyes and Pikes.THANKS

None for Walleye although will pick them up casting for pike many times. Number 5 Mepps with bucktail, either silver or gold spinner. Wont go up to Canada without at least 6-10 of those. They are Money.

I use #3 copper with plain hook first, but might use a #3 gold with plain hook if that's not working well. My fishing partner sticks with a #4 copper with plain hook all the time. It doesn't take long at Minaki for a dressed-hook mepps to become plain.... In addition, it generally doesn't seem to make much of a difference for pike, smallies or even walleye anyway IMO. But just before the sun is rising/setting or on an extremely overcast day, we'll sometimes put a 3" yellow [not chartreuse] twister tail on one of the hooks.

I use mepps 5 without hair only cause with hair there a dollar more!!!!silver in sun and copper or gold in overcast for walleye.....Pike ya gotta go with funky colors like a black fury with orange!!!!
Ive had good luck with red and white and black and yellow #4s for pike. Never had a walleye yet but that could change in three weeks!!
